moves.1. e4 d5: I wanted to experiment with the Scandinavian to see what kind of positions I got.
I'm thinking now that 0-0-0 might have been stronger than e6.
moves.8. Qf3 Rd8 9. Qxd5 Rxd5: Black is better developed, but my pieces aren't really very well coordinated.
moves.10. d4 a6 11. Bc4 Rd7 12. Be3 Be7 13. Be: This was perhaps unnecessary.  It is not difficult to counter.
moves.14. Bf3 Bxf3 15. Nxf3 O-O 16. O-O Rfd8 1: e5 might have been stronger here.
moves.18. Rdc1 h6 19. Rfe1 e5 20. dxe5 Nxe5 21: This was a dumb, dumb move.  I knew that the Be5 was loose.  Terrible thought process.
moves.23. Bxb6 Bf6 24. Be3 Rd7d5: Now I am a pawn down for nothing and have to figure out a way to stay in the game.
Not sure if this was best, but I wanted to take away the tempo for White.
moves.31. Re2 Rb5b3 32. Rd2 Rxa3: I have managed to regain my lost pawn.  The b2 pawn is pinned.
moves.33. Rc1 Rab3 34. Rxc6 Rb3xb2 35. Rcc2 Rx: We've reached an equal endgame here.  I was so relieved to get level that I offered my opponent a draw.  My draw offer was rejected.
This pawn endgame should be drawn also, but this position gave me the ability to gain a tempo with a check.
moves.48... g5+ 49. Kg3 f4+ 50. Kh3 Ke5: Now Black is better.  White's K will eventually get forced away from the base pawn.
